> Assuming my Junit suite has 10 methods to be executed.
> If I wish to execute only one single method out of the 10 methods 

several possibilities: 

- overwrite the suite() method to only include the method to run (very clean) 

- modify the test methods so that they don't begin with "start" (like atest)
(it's quick and dirty)
